metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: The "database" property defines a database as the data source. It has the following sub properties:
content.html: The "database" property defines a database as the data source. It has the following sub properties:

content.code_html:
Element Description
"connection" The name of a database connection
"execute" Array of SQL statements to be executed before data retrieval (optional)
"keyfield" The key field for the main table (optional)
"maintable" The main table for this application (optional)
"orderby" A fixed SQL orderby clause for the application (optional)
"sql" The SQL statement for retrieving data

content.text: This model fetches records containing Customer, City, and Country from a Customer table in an SQL database:
content.html: This model fetches records containing Customer, City, and Country from a Customer table in an SQL database:

content.code_html:
{
"database": {
    "connection": "mysql",
    "sql"       : "SELECT CustomerName, City, Country FROM Customers",
    "orderby"   : "CustomerName"
}
}

content.text: To allow users to filter data, you can add filter information to the model:
content.html: To allow users to filter data, you can add filter information to the model:

content.code_html:
"filteritems" : [
    {"item" : "CustomerName", "label" : "Customer"},
    {"item" : "City"},
    {"item" : "Country"}]

content.text: To allow users to sort data, you can add sort information to the model:
content.html: To allow users to sort data, you can add sort information to the model:

content.code_html:
"sortitems" : [
    {"item" : "CustomerName", "label" : "Customer"},
    {"item" : "City"},
    {"item" : "Country"}]

content.text: To allow users to update data, you can include update information in the model:
content.html: To allow users to update data, you can include update information in the model:

content.code_html:
"updateItems" : [
    {"item" : "CustomerName"},
    {"item" : "Address"},
    {"item" : "PostalCode"},
    {"item" : "City"},
    {"item" : "Country"}]

content.text: By default, AppML will let you filter, sort, or update data, only it is specified in the model.
content.html: By default, AppML will let you filter, sort, or update data, only it is specified in the model.

content.text: Database connections are defined in appml_config.php :
The configuration file can contain many database connections.
content.html: The configuration file can contain many database connections.

content.text: Since AppML allows you to execute SQL statements before the application is started, you can use this to create a database if needed:
content.html: Since AppML allows you to execute SQL statements before the application is started, you can use this to create a database if needed:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
{"database" : {"connection" : "myCDs","execute" : ["DROP 
 TABLE IF EXISTS CD_Catalog","CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS CD_Catalog (CDID 
 INT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,PRIMARY KEY (CDID),Title NVARCHAR(255),Artist NVARCHAR(255),Country NVARCHAR(255),Price 
 NUMBER)"]}}

"CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS CD_Catalog (CDID 
 INT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,PRIMARY KEY (CDID),Title NVARCHAR(255),Artist NVARCHAR(255),Country NVARCHAR(255),Price 
 NUMBER)"

content.code:
{"database" : {"connection" : "myCDs","execute" : ["DROP
TABLE IF EXISTS CD_Catalog","CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS CD_Catalog (CDID
INT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,PRIMARY KEY (CDID),Title NVARCHAR(255),Artist NVARCHAR(255),Country NVARCHAR(255),Price
NUMBER)"]}}

syntax_highlighting.text:
{"database" : {"connection" : "myCDs","execute" : ["DROP 
 TABLE IF EXISTS CD_Catalog","CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS CD_Catalog (CDID 
 INT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,PRIMARY KEY (CDID),Title NVARCHAR(255),Artist NVARCHAR(255),Country NVARCHAR(255),Price 
 NUMBER)"]}}

"CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS CD_Catalog (CDID 
 INT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,PRIMARY KEY (CDID),Title NVARCHAR(255),Artist NVARCHAR(255),Country NVARCHAR(255),Price 
 NUMBER)"

content.code_html:
{
"database" : {
"connection" : "myCDs",
"execute" : [
"DROP TABLE IF EXISTS CD_Catalog",
"CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS CD_Catalog (CDID INT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,PRIMARY KEY (CDID),Title NVARCHAR(255),Artist NVARCHAR(255),Country NVARCHAR(255),Price NUMBER)"
]
}}

 NUMBER)"
